other_tests.findings: Markedly hypercellular marrow (85%) diffusely involved by small lymphocytic infiltration (80%), with numerous small lymphocytes and scattered paraimmunoblasts.
Thickening in the small intestinal wall, with multiple lymphadenopathies in the abdominal cavity and retroperitoneum.

Tumor cells positive for CD3, CD7, CD8, CD43, CD56, TIA1, Granzyme B, and Bcl-2; negative for CD20, CD79a, CD10, Bcl-6, MUM-1, CD23, cyclin D1, CD2, CD4, CD5, and CD30. Ki-67 index 70%-80% near blood vessels and 5%-10% in tumor mass.
Revealed a small monoclonal T-cell population in a background of oligoclonal T-cells.
Pathogenic hotspot mutations of STAT5B and DNMT3A, along with likely pathogenic mutations and variants of uncertain clinical significance.
